&reftitle.parameters;
statement
A valid OCI statement identifier.
mode
Allows you to specify whether oci_execute should immediately commit database changes. The default value is OCI_COMMIT_ON_SUCCESS.
If you don't want statements to be committed automatically, specify OCI_NO_AUTO_COMMIT as your mode. Prior to PHP 5.3.2 and for PECL oci8 < 1.4 use OCI_DEFAULT which is an alias for OCI_NO_AUTO_COMMIT.
When using OCI_NO_AUTO_COMMIT mode, you're creating a transaction. Transactions are automatically rolled back when the connection is closed, or when the script ends. Explicitly call oci_commit to commit a transaction, or oci_rollback to abort it.
